measured_by: Balance Inventory of Desirable Responding – Short Version (BIDR-SV)
justification: Participants completed the BIDR-SV, "which measures self-deception and impression management, both related to social desirability".

measured_by: Balance Inventory of Desirable Responding – Short Version (BIDR-SV)
justification: The BIDR-SV is described as measuring "self-deception and impression management" in the social-desirability domain.

Participants completed "the Machiavellian Personality Scale (MPS), which measures people's propensity to distrust others, engage in amoral manipulation, seek control over others, and seek status for oneself."
The MPS includes an "Amorality" subscale that "measures a tendency to disregard moral standards and value behaviours that benefit oneself at the expense of others."
Correlational analyses refer to the "Distrust for others" subscale of the MPS, indicating this construct is captured by the scale.

topic_or_construct: dishonest behaviour / lying tendency (egoistic and prosocial lies)
justification: The study "utilizes the Temptation to Lie Card Game (TLCG) to investigate the effects of three incidental emotions... on dishonest decision-making," with the task recording rates of egoistic and prosocial lies.
